title: PayPal to Issue Dollar-Pegged Crypto Stablecoin Based on Ethereum - CoinDesk
summary: PayPal to launch dollar-pegged crypto stablecoin on Ethereum, available to US users. First major financial company to issue its own stablecoin. Users can transfer, pay with, or convert to/from PYUSD.

title: How to Spend Ethereum? Best Way to Spend ETH in 2024 - CryptoWallet.com
summary:
Sure, here are the main points from the article in less than 256 tokens:

* Ethereum is a popular cryptocurrency with over 50 million users worldwide.
* Many retailers now accept Ethereum as payment, including Crypto Emporium, Sling TV, Shopify, CheapAir, Overstock, Twitch, APMEX, Pacaso, NameCheap, and Newegg.
* Ethereum can be spent online or in person using a crypto card, P2P transfers, or directly from a wallet.
* Ethereum can be used to purchase a wide range of items, including jewelry, real estate, electronics, clothing, and more.
* CryptoWallet.com offers a crypto card that allows customers to spend Ethereum in real-time, with low fees and IBAN-compatible accounts for paying bills.
* P2P transfers allow customers to send Ethereum directly to another person or business, with services like BitPay offering this option.
* FAQs cover topics such as how to send Ethereum P2P, how

title: PayPal launches stablecoin tied to the US dollar, issued on Ethereum - Blockworks
summary: PayPal launches stablecoin tied to US dollar, issued on Ethereum. PayPal customers can purchase, send, convert, and fund purchases with the stablecoin starting Monday. PayPal USD is fully backed by US dollar deposits, US Treasuries, and similar cash equivalents. This is the first time a major US financial company has created a stablecoin, and PayPal aims to contribute to the growth of digital payments through responsible innovation and compliance.

title: Ethereum Whale Burns 2,500 ETH; Crypto Community Questions Motive - ZyCrypto
summary: An anonymous Ethereum whale, identified as "nd4.eth," transferred 2,500 ETH (worth $4.5 million) to a burn address, sparking curiosity within the crypto community. The move has been likened to a "ultrasound money narrative" by Laurence Day, while analysts from Lookonchain uncovered the whale's extensive holdings in GMX and GNS. The exact motive behind the transfer remains a mystery, with previous instances of accidental burns occurring, such as when an NFT collector inadvertently sent an NFT to a burn address.

title: How Ethereum Clients Work Together for Security and Consensus - hackernoon.com
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum clients work together to ensure security and consensus in the digital world. They use a decentralized network to verify transactions and prevent fraud, ensuring fairness and preventing manipulation of the system.

title: Valkyrie Amends Bitcoin Futures ETF To Include Ethereum Futures, Could Be First To Launch - Yahoo Finance
summary: Valkyrie, a financial services company, has amended its Bitcoin futures ETF to include Ethereum futures contracts, potentially becoming the first to launch. The fund's name will change to Valkyrie Bitcoin and Ether Strategy ETF. The SEC has up to 60 days to approve the changes, but the company is ahead of rivals in terms of its anticipated debut date.

title: Payments Giant PayPal to Launch Dollar-Pegged Stablecoin on Ethereum - Decrypt
summary: PayPal, a leading payments giant, is launching a dollar-pegged stablecoin called PayPal USD (PYUSD) on the Ethereum network. The stablecoin is backed by short-term treasuries, dollar deposits, and cash equivalents and will be available to eligible US users. PayPal CEO Dan Schulman expects the stablecoin to become a part of the overall payments infrastructure. Paxos Trust Co. will issue and manage the stablecoin, and starting next month, will publish public monthly reserve reports outlining the instruments composing the stablecoin's reserves. This move marks a significant step forward for blockchain technology and digital assets, according to Paxos CEO Charles Cascarilla.

title: I Have 1M Questions About the PayPal Stablecoin. Here Are 5 - CoinDesk
summary: PayPal's stablecoin, PYUSD, is not decentralized, but if users freeze funds in PayPal, it could benefit the company.

title: PayPal stablecoin PYUSD launches on Ethereum - CryptoSlate
summary: PayPal has launched a US dollar-backed stablecoin called PayPal USD (PYUSD) on the Ethereum blockchain. The stablecoin is fully backed by US dollar deposits, US Treasuries, and cash equivalents, and will be available for US customers. PayPal USD aims to bridge the gap between fiat and digital currencies, facilitating fast transfers of value and supporting global brands' expansion into digital assets. The issuance of PayPal USD is overseen by Paxos Trust Company, a fully licensed limited-purpose trust company subject to regulatory oversight. PayPal is committed to increasing consumer and merchant understanding of cryptocurrencies and stablecoins, and actively engaging with regulators as the industry evolves.

title: PayPal Stablecoin Fakes Flood Ethereum—Here's How to Find the Real One - Decrypt
summary: PayPal has announced a new stablecoin called PayPal USD (PYUSD) on the Ethereum network. Imposter tokens with the same ticker symbol (PYUSD) have already appeared on Uniswap, a decentralized exchange, in an attempt to cash in on the hype. PayPal has confirmed the real PYUSD contract address via Etherscan, and the token was created on November 8, 2022. The stablecoin is designed for payments and is backed by highly liquid and secure assets. However, it is unlikely that the imposter tokens currently trading on Uniswap are anything other than a cash grab.

title: Mystery Ethereum Burn of $4.5 Million Ignites Community Curiosity - DailyCoin
summary: An enigmatic individual known as nd4.eth sent $4.5 million worth of ether to a burn address, sparking curiosity and speculation within the cryptosphere. The motive behind this move remains unknown, with some speculating it could be a marketing stunt or a alignment with the "Ethereum's Ultrasound Money" narrative. On-chain analysts uncovered that the individual is a major holder of tokens from perpetual trading protocols, further deepening the mystery. The transfer has ignited a surge of interest and intrigue, with some commending the individual for reducing the supply of Ethereum.

title: Top 3 Price Prediction Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple: Altcoins suffer in the wake of a weakening BTC - FXStreet
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin's (BTC) price action is causing uncertainty among altcoins, with Ethereum (ETH) and Ripple (XRP) suffering. Open Interest and funding rates are also impacting cryptocurrency prices, with higher Open Interest indicating increased liquidity and new capital inflow, while a consistently high and positive funding rate implies a bullish sentiment. Bitcoin's price is expected to run back to the $30,400 range this week before potentially dropping to the $27,300 and $26,300 levels. If sellers outweigh buyers, Bitcoin's price could continue south, potentially reaching the $27,300 or $26,300 levels.

title: Is Ethereum preparing the ground for a bull run? - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum (ETH) may be setting up for a bull run, according to on-chain metrics. The Galaxy Score, a bullish indicator, was high, and whales continued to accumulate. Derivatives metrics were also positive, including a decline in exchange reserve and a green takers buy/sell ratio. However, investors are still experiencing losses, with a low number of addresses in profit. The MVRV Ratio and network activity remain high, and the token's network growth is increasing. Overall, the outlook for ETH is mixed, but the on-chain metrics suggest potential for a bullish trend reversal.

title: Ethereum staking continues to gain wider acceptance, but there’s a problem - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum staking continues to gain popularity, with the total amount staked reaching 21% of the circulating supply. However, the staking rewards have decreased as the number of validators has increased, leading to a thinner distribution of rewards. The Shapella upgrade has enabled withdrawals and marked a transition from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake, allowing individual holders to stake their ETH and earn passive income. Liquid staking tokens (LST) have also become popular, enabling users to participate in staking while still using their ETH for DeFi activities. Despite the decrease in staking rewards, Ethereum staking is expected to play a significant role in the evolution of the Ethereum network.

title: Ethereum Community Is Ablaze As 2500 ETH Anonymously Burned - Crypto Times
summary: An anonymous user with the ENS name nd4.eth transferred 2500 ETH to a null address, effectively burning it without any context. This transaction has gone viral within the crypto community and has left many curious about the motive behind it. Some have joked that the person reduced Ethereum supply, while an on-chain analyst observed that the user is a whale with significant holdings in other cryptocurrencies. The burning of the ETH refers to the permanent removal of the tokens from supply through the sending process to an inaccessible address.

title: 2,500 ETH Burned Today, Here’s What Happens to Price - U.Today
summary: An anonymous user transferred 2,500 ETH (worth $4.6 million) to a dead Ethereum wallet, sparking speculation in the crypto community. This event follows the EIP-1559 upgrade, which burns 2,500 ETH every 30 hours. Since the upgrade went live 2 years ago, a total of 3.5 million ETH ($6.4 billion) has been burned. Despite these burns, the ETH price has been unable to show significant performance, currently trading at $1,826. Additionally, Ethereum stakers are continuing to add ETH to the Ethereum 2.0 deposit contract, with over 27 million ETH now locked within the contract, a new all-time high.

title: Breaking: PayPal launches PYUSD stablecoin for payment - Cointelegraph
summary: PayPal, a leading financial technology company, has launched a new stablecoin called PayPal USD (PYUSD) on August 7. The US dollar-pegged stablecoin is issued by Paxos Trust Co. and fully backed by US dollar deposits, short-term Treasurys, and similar cash equivalents. It is built on Ethereum and designed for digital payments and Web3, with compatibility with crypto exchanges, Web3 apps, and crypto wallets. PayPal CEO Dan Schulman hopes the new stablecoin will become a part of the overall payments infrastructure. This launch marks the first stablecoin launched by a major payment processor, and PayPal boasts over 350 million active users. The regulatory environment around stablecoins in the US is gradually progressing toward more clarity, and PayPal USD is the most significant leap forward for digital assets and the financial industry.

title: Creath Among Web3 Companies to Launch in 2023 on Layer 2 Ethereum Protocol - Optimism. - TechCabal
summary: Creath, a Web3 company, plans to launch on Optimism (OP) Mainnet in Q4 of 2023. Optimism is a layer 2 Ethereum protocol offering low-cost and fast transactions with $2B on-chain value, $3B in saved gas fees, and $11M OP tokens distributed. Creath aims to leverage Optimism's scalability, simple integration, and low costs for improved application efficiency and user accessibility. The company will transition from ERC-20 to OP Mainnet, with OP airdrops for token holders. More information on Creath's transition will be released in the coming months. #Web3 #Optimism #Layer2 #Ethereum #Creath #Blockchain

title: $52.3 million Recovered From Curve Finance Heist - Ethereum World News
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

$52.3 million recovered from Curve Finance heist, with $19.7 million still missing. DeFi projects Alchemix Finance, JPEGd, and Metronome recovered $48.1 million through asset returns and white hat efforts. Curve Finance is offering a $1.85 million bounty for information leading to a court conviction. The deadline for voluntary returns has passed, and the bounty is now open to the public.

title: PayPal To Launch Its Own USD-Pegged Stablecoin Based on Ethereum - CryptoDaily
summary: PayPal is launching its own USD-pegged stablecoin called PayPal USD (PYUSD) on the Ethereum blockchain. This is the first global payments company to launch a stablecoin. PYUSD can be used for transfers, person-to-person payments, funding purchases, and converting digital assets to and from PayPal USD. The issuer of PYUSD is Paxos Trust Company, a fully licensed financial institution. PayPal has been actively exploring and integrating crypto services for the last couple of years and is holding almost $1 billion worth of crypto on behalf of its clients.

title: Cardano Witnesses ‘Impressive’ 198% Growth in Total Value Locked This Year Amid Price Decline: Analytics Firm - The Daily Hodl
summary: Cardano (ADA) has seen a significant increase in total value locked (TVL) this year, with a growth of 198% since the beginning of the year, according to crypto analytics firm Messari. Despite a price decline, Cardano's TVL has increased 9.7% quarter-over-quarter (QoQ) and 198.6% year-to-date (YTD), moving it up from 34th to 21st in overall TVL among all chains. The growth is attributed to accelerated development within the ecosystem, including new stablecoins, wallets, and other protocols, which have improved the user experience and diversified the ecosystem. Multichain solutions such as Hydra Head and Milkomeda C1 sidechain are also maturing and aim to support future activity increases.

title: Today's cryptocurrency prices: Check Bitcoin, Ethereum, Dogecoin, Tether rates - NewsBytes
summary: Today's cryptocurrency prices saw mixed movements, with some tokens gaining while others lost value. Bitcoin and Ethereum saw slight increases, while other popular cryptocurrencies like BNB, XRP, and Cardano experienced declines. The top 5 gainers of the day were XDC Network, Dash, Basic Attention Token, Hedera, and Optimism, while the biggest losers were Gala, Shiba Inu, Compound, Theta Network, and ApeCoin. The total cryptocurrency market capitalization saw a 0.12% increase over the last day, with a 2.05% increase in market volume. DeFi and NFT tokens also saw mixed movements, with some experiencing gains while others experienced losses.

title: PayPal launches its own crypto stablecoin on Ethereum - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary: PayPal has launched its own cryptocurrency, PYUSD, a US dollar-pegged stablecoin issued on the Ethereum blockchain and fully backed by USD deposits. Users can redeem PYUSD for dollars and other cryptocurrencies on PayPal's network, and fund purchases on its popular payments app Venmo. PayPal's CEO Dan Schulman aims to make the company a leader in digital payments using direct, fast, and cheaper transfer technology. This launch comes after PayPal received a BitLicense and started working on a stablecoin, but halted due to regulatory pressure. Now, PayPal sees a progressing regulatory environment and rising demand for an alternative stablecoin in a concentrated market.

title: Bitcoin Spark Creates Hybrid Approach To Ethereum and Bitcoin Scaling Solutions - Blockzeit
summary: Bitcoin Spark, a new Bitcoin fork, is introducing a hybrid approach to scaling solutions called Proof of Process (PoP). PoP combines elements of Proof of Work (PoW) and Proof of Stake (PoS) by requiring users to stake coins and provide processing power to the network. This hybrid system aims to provide enhanced speed, security, and scalability while reducing energy consumption. The project's development team has created a user-friendly mining program that can be installed on various devices, and rewards are calculated based on a combination of stake and work done using the network as remote computing power. The mining rewards also follow an elastic system based on revenue inflow, price of BTCS, and number of miners in the ecosystem. Bitcoin Spark aims to establish itself as a robust and efficient blockchain network, offering enhanced scalability and sustainability while empowering a diverse range of network participants.
